website_summaries.verdict: Light enough to wear all day, with little restriction of range of motion. The waist strap can be too tight for larger-framed users.
pros: Very heavy-duty straps that don’t restrict motion too much
Accessories can be attached to waist strap
cons: Leg straps aren’t easy to adjust
Big and tall users aren’t always comfortable in this harness, particularly at the waist, despite its size

customer_reviews.title: Saving lives and saving money, can it get any better?
customer_reviews.text: I've been getting these harnesses for my employees at the jobsite for over a year now and they always have nice things to say about them. The quality is great, they are comfortable and adjusting the straps is easy and they are very durable. The price has to be one of the most competitive on the market right now given the great quality and the overall comfort. I would highly recommend this item to anyone requiring fall protection, it just may save your life!
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: This is the best purchase I've made in my career.
customer_reviews.text: This is an OUTSTANDING piece of PPE. It is incredibly comfortable and I am confident that it will save my life if necessary. The customer Service from Guardian is also excellent. When mine arrived, a little plastic tab was broken. It was a cosmetic bit, meant to hold down the extra bit of belt, and not in any way necessary for the performance and safety of the PPE, but after a quick phone call, a little bag of replacement tabs were sent to me free of charge. I get a lot of compliments from coworkers who have PETZL, and they all say my equipment looks great. Guardian for life! (literally!)
customer_reviews.author: Adam Vana

customer_reviews.title: Im 6'6 300lb and this was SOOOO much more comfortable than the home depot harness i had
customer_reviews.text: Im 6'6 300lb and this was SOOOO much more comfortable than the home depot harness i had. I dont really need the back strap for what i do but it was nice and added back support. Although only downside is the back support will be hot after a while but better than the uncomfortable harness i used to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Stogie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and fit.
customer_reviews.text: Bought his and hers from this company. Husband is 5'11, 215lbs, Med/L fit perfectly. We cinched it up to a good fit and every position he took was comfortable. No pinching...very important... and really no movement of the harness at all. It becomes a second skin, exactly what we needed. The Small fit me just as perfectly, I'm 5'11, 160lbs. Excellent product that makes you look like a boss on the job-site.
customer_reviews.author: K Adams

customer_reviews.title: Faulty safety equipment
customer_reviews.text: I wear a harness as part of my daily routine and recently fell from a two story house, ergo time for a new harness. Out of the box this one looks great. High mobility and comfortable with my tool pouches. Sadly it came new with two of the impact indicators already deployed. Rendering this harness noncompliant in the eyes of OSHA. I am required to have a harness at all times. Now I have faulty equipment that I can afford to wait for a replacement and have to shell out nearly twice as much for an immediate replacement at a big box store. Highly unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN

customer_reviews.title: What a deal ?
customer_reviews.text: As a site safety officer for a construction company for quiet a few years, this has to be one of the best deals on the market today that i have ever seen. It is made well and not cheap but has a cheap price. I'm still trying to figure out how they made it and sell it for that price. I inspected every area of it an it is well made. The only thing is that even though it fits me, i did not get to try it on before i bought it . It comes in a sealed bag. So you might want to check the return policy.
customer_reviews.author: RDK

customer_reviews.title: Bad sizing.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a moderate Medium male. 185, 5'10. I wear medium american everything. This was way too big for me. I was on every last hole possible on the entire suit with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Darren P. Jones

customer_reviews.title: What’s your health worth?
customer_reviews.text: Scared up trimming a hedge on a 12 foot ladder, feared for a possible fall. This device allayed those fears, gave me reassurance. Well made harness, easy to put on and take off. You feel like a lineman when all geared up. People should alway operate at heights safely. Did you know 50 of falls from twenty feet are fatal? That’s all I needed to know. This is an honest review, I am not compensated in any way, shape or form.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Horne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, and exactly as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly as pictured. Used several times and fits well. I bought 2 one for me and one for co-worker. I am 5’9” 160lbs and ordered a medium. Plenty of room to make bigger if needed to use over winter clothing. I have not fallen yet and hope I never have to see if it truly works for that but with the way it fits I think it is safe to say it will work as designed perfectly. Thanks for making this affordable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T.

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have!!
customer_reviews.text: As a lineman/cable splicer this is a life saver. I'm usually working out of my bucket for 4-6 hrs straight sometimes. With my regular harness my back & shoulders were always bothering me. After using this harness I can already feel the difference. I'm 6'0, 230lbs and I thought a medium was going to be too small but it fits good.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: I spent 10 hours a day 6 to 7 days a week in this bastard!
customer_reviews.text: One of the top five harness that I have warn. I climbed a ton with this on ,inspecting stuff , tracking systems in the rack from sun up to son down! It’s heavy but I had a python bag on my belt for all my gages, field book , documents... it took heavy abuse and never let me down. Wouldn’t recommend it for welding pipe while in the rack, way too heavy to keep your body steady. It’s more for keeping the stress off your core with the padded belt and shoulders so you can do more climbing without the normal problems that a harness causes in a work day!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Branham

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be great.
customer_reviews.text: The M-L version fits me with a 38" waist. I like almost everything about this. Easy to adjust to your body, comfortable, and seems really sturdy. What I do not like about it are the strap "minders". They are a thin kind of plastic. I am not sure how long they will last before they tear. You can almost see them in the picture on the top of the shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice harness, however
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice harness, however, the picture and the description are incorrect. The one that I bought clearly has D-rings on the shoulder in the picture and also mentions that the shoulder d-rings can be used for lanyard keepers or retrieval hoist attachments. However, the one that shipped only shipped with breakaway lanyard keepers on the chest. I double checked the model number (11172) which is the one with the breakaways on the chest. Looking back on it, I suppose I should've checked that the model number matched what I saw in the picture. On second thought, I shouldn't have to waste my time checking that. Just something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Sprinkler3

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of heights but I trust this and it fits!
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of heights but I trust this! Ok so your question how does it fit. I feel like it fits great. I’m 5’11” 270. I would say built like a past athlete. I don’t get that feeling of this just barely fits, hope it works... lol. Fits great, with room to spare. Comfortable, don’t really notice I have it on while working in my bucket truck.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible I'm 6'1 and 195lbs and this harness is adjusted all the way open and when it's on me I can't even bend over with it on waste of money company don't know what sizes it fits terrible
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product says fits person 5ft 7 in to 6ft 7in ...
customer_reviews.text: Product says fits person 5ft 7 in to 6ft 7in 185 to 310 pounds but I am 6ft 245 lbs and the belt is on the last whole I asked about it and got no response about my question then my boss purchase the same item but in a medium / large and the belt is the same size
customer_reviews.author: samuel lees

customer_reviews.title: labeled wrong
customer_reviews.text: to avoid any further confusion. the pic on amazon shows Burgundy straps, you'll probably get red straps. no biggy. the data tag on harness says its rated to 310#, but the paperwork shows its rated for 420#. that was my concern, that I received the wrong harness, but part number and documentation shows otherwise. Also if you like biscuits and gravy like I do, the cumber bun belt is almost to short, be prepared to order a different size belt!! I feel confident I received what I ordered. Will update as to how comfortable this belt is after a 10 hour day of wearing it. hence the ***.
customer_reviews.author: michael Liljegren

customer_reviews.title: Check sizing not from amazon
customer_reviews.text: Wrong size was sent. Not sure can't wear it. Reviews don't give justice to sizing. Read seperate reviews not on Amazon for size charts. Everything but waist belt fits (too big by 3 buckle holes) but only on tightest settings. I wear Size 34 waist jeans. Will update when i get the one that fits
customer_reviews.author: Libby M. Zivkovic

customer_reviews.title: Because we all fall down... sometimes
customer_reviews.text: When up in the high steel. Since we have to wear a rig to comply with the latest OSHA / MSHA regulations. This rig is comfortable without being bulky or restrictive while giving peace of mind. Great quality, secure, and easily adjustable for those times when you need to add layers to fight the cold.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: bad fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'10" and 185 and fit and the legs will never fit right nomatter how I adjust. They dont go 45o up they are supposed to, they are flat around severely limiting mobility. Its just like the pics show, look at the legs. Waste of money and energy to wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: The harness is very comfortable and easy to get into
customer_reviews.text: The harness is very comfortable and easy to get into. Wearing it all day and being able to maneuver comfortably at heights makes it easy to do my job safely. I haven’t had to use it with a positioning lanyard at height yet, but when I tested it on the ground, it didn’t have any uncomfortable pinch points and did a good job of evenly distributing the weight. The integrated rings for clipping in tool lanyards is also helpful.
customer_reviews.author: MarkM

customer_reviews.title: Product is as described. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use and put on. We use it for roofers. I like how it can adjust to every roofers size. We bought 2 to try them out, then came back for more! I like this company's items. They all seem durable and I have not had any issue with safety.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Christina Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Just what I needed! Too keep me safe and alive!
customer_reviews.text: Vary stable harnessing and the value was perfect for my budget. As a small male finding durable safety equipment is difficult outside of a children’s climbing supplies.. & the quality of this company is above the grade.. Thank you! Finding a durable rated safety harness that fits comfortably and properly was a chore.. until your company! Thanks, again! Your appreciated!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The item in the picture and description shows 3 D-Rings. The one i received only had a single back D-Ring.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Base
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic harness. It’s EXACTLY, what I wanted. I am building a large scale cosplay costume and using this harness as a base to hold everything up and together.
customer_reviews.author: Liz W

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive daily harness
customer_reviews.text: It fits well and is comfortable. The rings on the shoulder straps are a bit cheap but not a safety area just for holding accessories. Some straps are very difficult to adjust. I wear it daily and the comfort and support are top notch for the price point
customer_reviews.author: Will Mullady

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The first day, my husband wore it for 10 hours straight without any discomfort. He was able to drive from jobsite to jobsite without issue. Great product
customer_reviews.author: DesertSongbyrd

customer_reviews.title: This harness is by far the most comfortable I've worn
customer_reviews.text: I sometimes must ware fall protection ten hours straight. This harness is by far the most comfortable I've worn. The padded shoulder straps really helps. It's also easy to adjust. I ware a tool belt that weights between 60 and 70 pounds over the top of this harness, making the back support a must. All in all by the end of the day I'am less fatigued when I have the Guardian on then one of the older harness. If you have to use a harness I highly recommend this one, it wares just as good as one of the higher priced models.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my bf who is a general contractor. He loves it because it comes with nice padding which are placed in the perfect places and is sturdy. He said this brand is known to make quality and reliable products amongst contractors.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed protection
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed protection. Don't cheap out when it comes to your ass being saved. This one holds on to you very well and if you would fall your "boys" are much less likely to become a statistic... trust me, I used mine during long days at heights most people would never work at and it was a comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: JasonVM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome harness for me
customer_reviews.text: Awesome harness for me. I don't use it every day but ive used it all day multiple times and it is way better then the ones they provide. I've used it for climbing and tying rebar with the work positioning chains, Used it on scaffold, and in lifts i love it especially for the price as do my coworkers I have ordered 4 more for them.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and finish
customer_reviews.text: This is very comfortable and allows for easy movement. Felt no restrictions in mobility and the padding made wearing this for hours a pleasure. It really made a difference over lighter padding of some harnesses that begin to irritate just from the drag of the tether. The adjustments are quick and sure. I especially like having the waste belt as many of the others only have the chest belt alone. The construction stitching is clean and appears to be well made. Once the initial adjustments were made, it took less than a minute to get belted in.
customer_reviews.author: Mick McGrill

customer_reviews.title: Super speedy delivery.
customer_reviews.text: I checked every inch of the harness and found it to be highly serviceable. Will update as things progress..
customer_reviews.author: Dean L.

customer_reviews.title: Iron Worker
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for quite some time now, it holds it's own nicely and is very welcoming to toolbags or sidebags. The front straps for the chest have small black clips for holding the slack left over after tightening the torso, but they are useless, other than that I love every feature of this Harness.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I received the harness yesterday. I am 300lbs 6'1 and wear a 46x30 size pants. I'm not no little guy lol. So, I have a hard time finding a harness that comfortably fits. The first time I took this out of the box, I was amazed. Not just buy the build and the foam shoulder pads, but by how the first time I put it on, it fit like a glove! It is comfortable enough to wear it around the house.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Tower harness
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and fits me perfectly. I am 6'1" about 190 lbs and have used it with my 90' Rohm 25 ham radio tower to install various antennas. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PT Padgett

customer_reviews.title: Easy on easy off
customer_reviews.text: I love it. The best part is the legs and stomach strap are like a belt so you dont jave to step onto it! makes it much easier to put on and more adjustable in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Good Harness
customer_reviews.text: Much better quality than cheaper harnesses. I buy these for construction worked and don't get fit complaints. Wearing well.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Duce

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: REALLY COMORTABLE... when it comes to prolonged wearing it's the most important thing, right behind safety, where I believe it excels also. Now... they make much better and just a comfortable harnesses, BUT NOT AT THIS PRICE. They do tend to fall on the larger side when size it so just be careful when considering the size you order
customer_reviews.author: Albert Christian Molda

customer_reviews.title: just as described
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to wear and highly adjustable to fit all body styles. The hope is I will never have to find out how well it works. but I am comfortable knowing that if I do. the Quality is apparent and it will do its job.
customer_reviews.author: Canmandad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love this harness! Very comfortable, perfect for what I need. And the price is great. I like this one better than the $350 one I had.
customer_reviews.author: Carey Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Great safety purchase that doesn't risk injury to groin vessels
customer_reviews.text: Great safety purchase that doesn't risk injury to groin vessels. Sits you into a chair type position if you fall. Guys said they did not weigh that much and did not restrict movements to work.
customer_reviews.author: SarahK

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really nice. It came with two different belts so that very large people can use the larger belt and tall thin people can use the smaller belt. Lots of padding and very secure feeling
customer_reviews.author: Bret C.

customer_reviews.title: Not your old body harness.
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other full body harnesses I have used, this is the most comfortable. Wore it for several hours and forgot I still had it on when cleaning up after the project. This harness also costs quite a bit less than other leading brands that are not as comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Woods

customer_reviews.title: This is a very durable well-made harness.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second guardian purchase. This is an excellent harness. Very well-made with durable stitching and heavy D rings. As a wife it makes me feel better knowing my husband is well protected when he's working up high.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Bagwell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product great value
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to buy my own harness instead of using the run of the mill that they hand out at work it’s great love the extra D rings would definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Raul Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Comfort a 10. Not as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: I wear my harness 8-10 hrs a day. Comfort is a 10. The pads on the shoulders are amazing. The belt helps to keep the weight of the harness off my body. Unlike the picture when shipped. I’d did not have the shoulder metal attachment points. I was a little disappointed due to the fact I connect tools with lanyards daily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Nice harness at a great price. I would recommend for anyone
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Guardian Fall Protection 11170 M-L Seraph Construction Harness
customer_reviews.text: Guardian Fall Protection 11170 M-L Seraph Construction Harness. I DID GET IT DELIVERED AND I HAVE NOT USE IT YET, BUT I WILL VERY SOON FOR I HAVE TWO TALL TREES TO CUT DOWN AND IT WILL BE VERY HANDY FOR SAFETY PURPOSE. PLUS I WILL BE USING IT ON MY FISHING TRIP FOR THE WATER IS ROUGH AND WITH THIS CONSTRUCTION HARNESS, IT WILL PROCTECT ME FROM BEING KNOCK AROUND. THANK YOU FOR I MIGHT BE ORDERING TWO MORE FOR MY FELLOW CREW ON ROUGH SEA TRIPS.
customer_reviews.author: QUINATA

customer_reviews.title: Your life depends on your equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is a full feature unit no cheep junk with this unit. Adjustable to fit with a lot of comfort. Will last me many years. All at a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Ed S

customer_reviews.title: Much Better than the ones at Big Box Stores
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and love the waist / tool belt with D rings
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: Excellent harness for the price. With the tool bag these are essential for any carpenters that need to be under a fall protection plan. Most of my guys buy suspenders for their tool bags anyhow,, with this they don't need to use suspenders the harness works very well in place of and insures that they have a harness in at all times!! B
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Great quality fits good and has enough places to put ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality fits good and has enough places to put his linyard on. Great price we cant find this anywhere by where we work so convienance paid off arrived right on time.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Did anyone else receive the harness red?
customer_reviews.text: I just received my harness today and I clearly remembered this harness being burgundy when I placed my order and I received it in red. It fits me well but really dissapointed in receiving the wrong color.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Great comfort and fit. Feel very safe using this harness...
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Excellent harness for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent harness for the money. Very comfortable and well made. I wish it had the quick connect system instead of the regular buckle style.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Skicko

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first purchase of this harness. I have encouraged my friends to buy this for the safety, comfort, quality workmanship and the different features.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Daye

customer_reviews.title: He says its great, so much so that many of the other ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband is an iron worker and got this for work. He says its great, so much so that many of the other guys purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: JVal

customer_reviews.title: Great harness
customer_reviews.text: Great harness. My only complaint, I wish it had a longer D ring strap on the back. It's very difficult to attach the lanyard once it's on. The harness is very comfortable, I can wear it all day, in and out of the bucket truck. Plenty of attachment points. Overall, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Suelter

customer_reviews.title: Hang Safe
customer_reviews.text: Smarty crafted 👍🏼 harness with lots of options for adjusting and clipping on. You're life and well being is worth every penny of this master product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Very good service with Amazon and Guardian had to return the first one i purchase due to sizing very easy return and prompt delivery of the new one which i then purchased. the harness is very well made and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: B Colorado

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good harness, but I would by the L/XL if you have a bulky waist.
customer_reviews.text: Bought theM/L size fits ok, but the waist belt could have been a little longer. Still it’s a nice harness for the money
customer_reviews.author: Harold Scott

customer_reviews.title: I love the back support and shoulder straps very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This thing is way nicer and cheaper than most others.. I love the back support and shoulder straps very comfortable.. I hope I never have to test it...
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Sturdy, Well Priced
customer_reviews.text: This harness has an amazing fit with well-supported hook points. It Adjusts nicely to my hight. I'm a bit taller and slim, this accommodates perfectly where others fall short in that regard. Osha approved and comfortable, I'll be using this brand again soon!
customer_reviews.author: Elkins

customer_reviews.title: A great buy for contractors
customer_reviews.text: An awesome harness. I spend multiple hours per day wearing it and it is durable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris T

customer_reviews.title: Fits nice s
customer_reviews.text: 6’3 275 and this thing fits like a dream. I got the xl xxl one. Way more comfortable than the cheap yellow ones and the back support belt is a nice feature to it. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Harnes i have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best safety harness I have EVER used!!!!!! It is sooo comfortable, easy to latch and very well built. I feel safe and secure in this and its so comfortable to wear even after a long day. I am sooo happy I bought this. Its great for me!
customer_reviews.author: Ty B

customer_reviews.title: accurately listed the sizes - very good quality
customer_reviews.text: This fully met our expectations. The size was accurate and the quality is very good. I will up date this review as we continue to use the product and can verify it's quality as we use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gemini

customer_reviews.title: Not great for regular wear
customer_reviews.text: Decent price if you need a harness occasionally. If you plan on wearing it regularly Id look elsewhere. Leg straps are horribly uncomfortable. Back padding is nice but will pull your shirt up your back.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Like the 3 tie in points.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the feature of hooking in back or either side. This kept tether out of way, depending on where and what you were doing. Once fit the first time, it was easy and quickly put on.
customer_reviews.author: Tom - Classic Fly Tier

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit skinny folks well.
customer_reviews.text: This harness is not a good fit for the tall and skinny amongst us. I'm 6'2" and 165lbs with a 34" waist. The issue is that the waist belt needs to be cinched in so far that the side rings become front rings and become unusable for positioning. The shoulder pads also tend to drop; I may tape them in place. Otherwise, it's not a bad harness for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lurve

customer_reviews.title: Good to go! Be SAFE
customer_reviews.text: Guys really like the comfort, and they are nice looking. Great feeling of safety!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I recommend highly. Sizes are on the larger end
customer_reviews.text: High quality of manufacture. What impressed me the most was the heavy duty materials and the safety features. I recommend highly. Sizes are on the larger end!
customer_reviews.author: Goody

customer_reviews.title: Best budget harness
customer_reviews.text: Paid $300 for a Klein harness and it was junk. The guardian is comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: it fits great and give me the protection I
customer_reviews.text: Use it to clime my 30 ft palm tree. it fits great and give me the protection I need
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The harness is a little heavy but when worn correctly it's not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon L

customer_reviews.title: bet your life
customer_reviews.text: Well made , can bet your life on it . all hardware well made and smooth edges
customer_reviews.author: Bells201

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed by the quality of this harness. I reviewed several others before deciding on this one. Price was an important factor for me. This harness turned out to me much better than what I was expecting. I feel very secure with this harness on. The strapping is heavy duty, there are D-rings in all of the right places, and the combination of waist and sternum straps provide a feeling of security. I am glad that I did not spend hundreds of dollars more for a different harness. I highly recommend this harness.
customer_reviews.author: Laszlo Kovecses

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Only thing I don’t like is that the button snaps wear out if you're using the harness 5+ times, 48hrs a week.
customer_reviews.author: scott saweikis

customer_reviews.title: Value that is not a let down
customer_reviews.text: Great value, comfortable fit, never a waste of money to invest in personal safety.
customer_reviews.author: David L McCulloch

customer_reviews.title: Harness with toolbelt
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner harness for those serious about scaffolding. Fully customizable to personal suits. Fantastic harness until you can afford top of line.
customer_reviews.author: Lo Bo

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, but should I ever end up fully testing it I am confident it will do what it needs to
customer_reviews.author: MPH

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Used for roofing. It provided really good back support, has just enough padding to be comfortable and not bulky. It also has just enough space to hang some tools off of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared C.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable on the shoulders. Very easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Jr mx

customer_reviews.title: This harness saved my life today
customer_reviews.text: I was working building Symon forms and I hooked my positioning hooks to a handle and the handle gave out.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah

customer_reviews.title: Fit a broad range of men
customer_reviews.text: The price was right and the need was strong. I use this harness 5 days a week. It's a bit heavy but it's well padded and it's worth the extra weight,
customer_reviews.author: JLVinkowski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Harness workes great. I only wish it came with a longer belt.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: this was too heavy to be of use when roofing.
customer_reviews.author: Sc

customer_reviews.title: The price/value is perfect for my infrequent tower climbs to the 50' working ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading about the loss of another ham radio operator, I tossed out my old Lineman's Belt used to climb telephone phone poles in the 70s. Tower climbing is different and so are the safety rules. This provides one element of a Personal Fall Arrest system needed to climb safely and with confidence. At height, you must be able to work hands-free. A Positioning Lanyard is needed for proper "position", as this is "fall arrest". Do not confuse nor mix the two. The harness is the core of a safety layer needed to protect you at all times. The price/value is perfect for my infrequent tower climbs to the 50' working height.
customer_reviews.author: Al R- Rockville MD

customer_reviews.title: Safety
customer_reviews.text: Great for fall protection but I find it not so useful to work on my tower, no seat support while hanging.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: its like most of the harnesses are made for over sized ...
customer_reviews.text: wish it was a little bit smaller, its like most of the harnesses are made for over sized people.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort is key
customer_reviews.text: The lumbar support made all the difference between this and your generic fall arrest harness. nano-loc attachments went on very easily and it fit perfectly.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great harness--one of the few we could find that came in XXL for the big guys.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and safe

customer_reviews.title: This harness is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: More bells and whistles than i expected. Walking in it and workin in it are comfortable. this harness is more secure than the old one i had and definately keeps me secure while hanging windows on a six story building!! Tried it out for one week before i wrote this review, great product from the makers of the best fall protection!

customer_reviews.title: Adjusts well to fit comfortably. He's 6' and 225 pounds
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son. Adjusts well to fit comfortably. He's 6' and 225 pounds. High quality. This should last for decades!

customer_reviews.text: Comfortable harness with lots of adjustment for a good price

product_meta.title: Guardian Fall Protection 11171 XL-XXL Seraph Construction Harness with Side D-Rings
product_meta.description:
Size:XL-XXL| Style:Construction Harness/Side D-RingsThe Guardian Fall Protection, "seraph construction Harness" Is specially designed with six points of adjustment and stretchable shoulder straps. This product includes: shoulder pads, cradle Seat, Quick adjust torso buckles, padded waist belt, D-ring lanyard keepers (which double as retrieval hoists), impact indicator, hammer loops, and Tongue buckle leg straps. This model's size is built specifically for individuals whose height ranges from 5-Foot to 6-foot 3-inch and whose weight ranges from 140 to 250 pounds. This version of the "seraph construction Harness" Possesses side D-Rings!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Guardian Fall Protection, "Seraph Construction Harness" is specially designed with six points of adjustment and stretchable shoulder straps. This product includes: shoulder pads, cradle seat, quick adjust torso buckles, padded waist belt, D-ring lanyard keepers (which double as retrieval hoists), impact indicator, hammer loops, and tongue buckle leg straps. This model's size is built specifically for individuals whose height ranges from 5-Foot to 6-Foot 3-Inch and whose weight ranges from 140 to 250 pounds. This version of the "Seraph Construction Harness" possesses side D-rings!
feature_bullets: Tongue buckle leg straps and side D-rings
